roleset.name: help grow, develop

example.name: nurture-v: transitive
example.text: He also vowed to `` make every effort to nurture ... a constructive new relationship that [*T*-2] has been forged [*-1] with participating employee groups . ''
example.arg: constructive new relationship that [*T*-2] has been forged [*-1] with participating employee groups

example.name: nurture-n: arg1
example.text: Can the voluminous broadcast of such TV dramas on TV channels [seahome] : bring pleasant visual enjoyment and spiritual nurture to viewers ?

example.name: nurturing-n
example.text: Animals with few offspring can devote more resources to the nurturing and protection of each individual offspring , thus reducing the need for many offspring .

roleset.note: NURTURE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'nurture' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from nurture.01-v predicate notes)
